page.title: 01Gazeteer.
page.content: The overall impression given by the grid area,is that of a sleepy, comfortable,rural part of Worcestershire,subject to few,if any, of the extremes of wealth or poverty. 17 farms are named,which specialise in arable, livestock or soft fruit growing,with areas of both natural deciduous and some planted coniferous woodland.The fields still have hedge boundaries with few stone walls or wooden fences. As car ownership has increased in recent years,the largest of the 15 settlements have become dormatory villages for families working or going to school in Worcester or Malvern. 44 children from the area travel by bus or car to attend Dyson Perrins CE High School, which is to the SW of the area. Another 15 will be starting in September 1985.
